title: What the Green Lights Do on Your Apple Watch + Ways to Disable Them

steps.title: The green lights on your Apple Watch are the heart rate sensors.
steps.content: The green lights on your Apple Watch are the heart rate sensors. These lights periodically flash when you're wearing your Apple Watch to measure your heart rate. These lights can be disabled by turning off the watch's heart rate sensor. There's no way to keep the heart rate sensor on and also turn off the green lights. According to Apple, this is called "photoplethysmography," which works around the fact that blood is red and absorbs green light. [1] X Research source The amount of blood flowing in your wrist increases and decreases with the beating of your heart. This also affects how much green light is absorbed from the sensors on the back of your Apple Watch, which is how it can measure your heart rate.

steps.title: Press the Digital Crown and select the Settings app.
steps.content: Press the Digital Crown and select the Settings app. The Settings app has a gray icon with gears on it.

steps.title: Select Privacy & Security > Health.
steps.content: Select Privacy & Security > Health . This will open privacy settings relating to what health metrics your watch can gather.

steps.title: Toggle off heart rate.
steps.content: Toggle off heart rate. This will disable the green light sensors on the bottom of your Apple Watch.

steps.title: Open the Watch app.
steps.content: Open the Watch app. The Apple Watch app has a dark gray icon with an image of an Apple Watch on it.

steps.title: Select Privacy.
steps.content: Select Privacy . You may have to scroll down to see this option.

steps.title: Toggle off heart rate.
steps.content: Toggle off heart rate. This will disable the green light sensors on the bottom of your Apple Watch.

steps.title: Check your Workout or Mindfulness app.
steps.content: Check your Workout or Mindfulness app. You may have an active workout or breathing exercise going. If so, the green lights on your Apple Watch may flash due to your watch needing to check your heart rate more often. And as such, the green lights could continue to flash after you remove your watch. To end a workout or breathing exercise, open the corresponding app and swipe right, then tap the End button. [2] X Research source [3] X Research source
